page.title: 02Landscape around Raveley
page.content: The undulating ground of this area sees the villages of Great and Little Raveley and Wistow built in shallow valleys, each with a small brook and area of woodland. The main view is always fields, with few hedges and trees. These trees are often all that is marking past sites of hedges. The area is dotted with farm houses and buildings, many barns are of the Dutch type of metal construction, few old barns built in timber and brick remain. The colour of the landscape changes with the seasons. Autumn is predominantely brown with ploughed and newly sown fields. Spring is all green with splashes of acid yellow of the oilseed rape flower. Summer, the golden wheat and barley and then black as the straw from the harvest is burnt. With a change to more ploughing in, stubble burning has been reduced.
